questions.prompt: A customer has a previous balance of ${prev_balance}, made a payment of ${payment_made}, and incurred new charges of ${new_charges}. Calculate the current balance.
questions.explanation: To calculate the current balance: Previous Balance - Payment Made + New Charges

questions.prompt: A customer with a previous balance of ${prev_balance} made a payment of ${payment_made} on the 15th of the month. They also had new charges of ${new_charges} applied on the 20th. Calculate the final balance.
questions.explanation: To calculate the final balance: Previous Balance - Payment Made + New Charges

questions.prompt: A customer with a previous balance of ${prev_balance} made a payment of ${payment_made} and had a late fee of $15 applied. They also incurred new charges of ${new_charges}. Calculate the final balance.
questions.explanation: To calculate the final balance: Previous Balance - Payment Made + Late Fee + New Charges

questions.prompt: A customer started service on ${start_date} with a monthly rate of ${monthly_rate}. Calculate the prorated charge for the first month.
questions.explanation: To calculate prorated charges: (Days of service in month / Total days in month) × Monthly Rate

questions.prompt: A customer started a service with a monthly rate of ${monthly_rate} on ${start_date}. Calculate the prorated charge for the first partial month of service.
questions.explanation: To calculate prorated charges: (Days of service in month / Total days in month) × Monthly Rate

questions.prompt: A customer started a premium service with a monthly rate of ${monthly_rate} on ${start_date} and received a 10% discount for the first month. Calculate the prorated and discounted charge.
questions.explanation: First calculate the prorated amount: (Days of service / Total days in month) × Monthly Rate, then apply the 10% discount

questions.prompt: A customer canceled service on ${cancel_date} and reactivated on ${reactivate_date}. If the monthly rate is ${monthly_rate}, calculate the credit for the days of no service.
questions.explanation: Calculate the days between cancellation and reactivation, then: (Days of no service / Total days in month) × Monthly Rate

questions.prompt: A customer suspended service on ${cancel_date} and resumed on ${reactivate_date}. During suspension, a maintenance fee of $5 applies. If the monthly rate is ${monthly_rate}, calculate the net credit.
questions.explanation: Calculate the credit for days of no service, then subtract the maintenance fee

questions.prompt: A customer downgraded from a premium plan (${monthly_rate}/month) to a basic plan ($30/month) on the 15th of a 30-day month. Calculate the credit for the downgrade.
questions.explanation: Calculate the difference in rates, then prorate for the remaining days: (Premium - Basic) × (Remaining days / Total days)

questions.prompt: A customer was incorrectly charged ${reversal_amount} on ${reversal_date}. Calculate the credit amount including 5% interest.
questions.explanation: Calculate the interest on the incorrect charge: Original Amount + (Original Amount × 5%)

questions.prompt: A customer was incorrectly charged ${reversal_amount} for 15 days. If the daily interest rate is 0.1%, calculate the total refund amount.
questions.explanation: Calculate the interest for each day and add to the original amount: Original Amount + (Original Amount × 0.1% × 15)

questions.prompt: A customer was incorrectly charged ${reversal_amount} on ${reversal_date}. The company policy is to refund double the incorrect amount plus $20 for inconvenience. Calculate the total refund.
